summary: chelsea have made an offer for fc tokyo 's 22 - year - old forward yoshinori muto , according to club president naoki ogane . the japan international , who has played for the j - league side since 2013 , will join chelsea 's dutch partner club vitesse arnhem on loan next season if he completes a move to stamford bridge this summer . ogane claims that chelsea 's interest in muto is not connected to the £ 200million sponsorship deal they signed with japanese company yokohama rubber in february .

aspect: - Chelsea have made an offer for FC Tokyo's 22-year-old forward Yoshinori Muto.
- Muto will join Chelsea's Dutch partner club Vitesse Arnhem on loan next season if he completes a move to Stamford Bridge this summer.
- Chelsea's interest in Muto is not connected to their £200million sponsorship deal with Japanese company Yokohama Rubber.
- Muto is the first Japanese player to be linked with a move to Chelsea.
- Muto has graduated from Keio University two weeks ago.
- Muto has scored 13 goals in his debut season with FC Tokyo.
- Muto has a shot at goal during Japan's Asian Cup match against Palestine.
- Yokohama Rubber will become Chelsea's official shirt sponsors from the start of the 2015-16 season.
explain: Chelsea have expressed interest in signing FC Tokyo's 22-year-old forward Yoshinori Muto, with the player set to move to Chelsea's Dutch partner club, Vitesse Arnhem, next season on loan if the deal materializes.

The aspect emphasizes that if Muto completes a move to Chelsea this summer, he will join Vitesse Arnhem, a Dutch club and Chelsea's partner club, on loan next season. The loan spell is mentioned as part of the agreement between Chelsea and Muto should a transfer occur.

The aspect highlights that the interest of Chelsea in signing Muto is not motivated by their recent sponsorship deal with Yokohama Rubber. The £200million partnership with the Japanese company was signed in February 2021, but the club's pursuit of the FC Tokyo striker predates the agreement and is not a result of it.
A core idea of this aspect is that Yoshinori Muto is the first Japanese player to be linked with a move to Chelsea.

Muto has graduated from Keio University just two weeks ago. This aspect informs us that Muto has finished his studies recently. It is not necessarily related to his soccer career or potential move to Chelsea, but it could indicate that he is ready for a new challenge in his personal and professional life.
According to the aspect given, one of the highlights of Yoshinori Muto's career was when he scored 13 goals in his debut season with FC Tokyo.

Muto is a professional football player who plays for FC Tokyo in the J-League. He is a forward who is known for his ability to score goals. The given aspect describes him in action during a football match between Japan and Palestine in the AFC Asian Cup. During this match, he attempted to score a goal by taking a shot on goal. The term "shot on goal" refers to an effort by a player to score a goal by kicking the ball towards the opponent's goal. It indicates that Muto displayed his ability to attack and create scoring opportunities for his team during the match. His performance in the match, including his shot on goal, may have caught the attention of Chelsea and other football clubs.

Yokohama Rubber will become Chelsea's official shirt sponsors from the start of the 2015-16 season. This means that Yokohama Rubber will have the rights to place their logo on the Chelsea football team's shirts during the next season.
